title: Microwave Flan Recipe
description: Flan is made easier with the convenience of the microwave. This is the fastest and easiest flan you'll ever find.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Microwave Flan 2.2 (25) 22 Reviews 3 Photos Flan is made easier with the convenience of the microwave. This is the fastest and easiest flan you'll ever find. Submitted by anar_73 Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 to 9 - inch flan Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 cups white sugar, divided 2 cups milk 1 tablespoon vanilla extract 4 eggs Directions Heat 1 cup of sugar (dry) in a saucepan over medium heat. Do not stir until you start to see the sugar melting and bubbling. When the sugar is completely melted and golden brown, pour it into a 9 inch glass or ceramic pie plate and tilt to coat. In a large bowl, mix the milk, remaining sugar, vanilla and eggs until well blended. Pour into the pie plate. Cook in the microwave at 50% power for 7 minutes, then cook at 100% power for 8 minutes. A knife inserted into the center of the flan should come out clean when it is done. If it is not done after the 8 minutes, cook at one minute intervals, checking each time. Cool and refrigerate before serving. To serve, warm the bottom of the pie plate over a pan of simmering water to loosen the caramelized sugar. Place a serving plate on top of the dish, and invert so that the flan is on the serving dish and the caramelized coating is on top. I Made It Print 40 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Microwave Flan 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  Selest Visser 04/05/2020 I followed the recipe to the letter but it did not work. It's edible but doesn't look like it is supposed to. 1 You’ll Also Love Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings Caramel-Glazed Flan 119 Ratings Pumpkin Flan Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 128 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings Baked Flan 514 Ratings Aracely's Flan 40 Ratings Coconut Cheese Flan (Flan de Coco y Queso) 47 Ratings Pumpkin Pie Flan 19 Ratings Pina Colada Flan 9 Ratings Original Mexican Flan Napolitano 3 Ratings 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: anar_73
instructions: Heat 1 cup of sugar (dry) in a saucepan over medium heat. Do not stir until you start to see the sugar melting and bubbling. When the sugar is completely melted and golden brown, pour it into a 9 inch glass or ceramic pie plate and tilt to coat.;In a large bowl, mix the milk, remaining sugar, vanilla and eggs until well blended. Pour into the pie plate.;Cook in the microwave at 50% power for 7 minutes, then cook at 100% power for 8 minutes. A knife inserted into the center of the flan should come out clean when it is done. If it is not done after the 8 minutes, cook at one minute intervals, checking each time. Cool and refrigerate before serving.;To serve, warm the bottom of the pie plate over a pan of simmering water to loosen the caramelized sugar. Place a serving plate on top of the dish, and invert so that the flan is on the serving dish and the caramelized coating is on top.
